thread.title: Colorado Springs computer chip maker acquired
thread.title_full: Colorado Springs computer chip maker acquired

author: The Associated Press
title: Colorado Springs computer chip maker acquired
text:
Colorado Springs computer chip maker acquired The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. 
Atmel Corp., which employs about 1,000 workers in a computer chip manufacturing plant in Colorado Springs, has agreed to be acquired by Dialog Semiconductor PLC in a $4.6 billion deal that is expected to be completed early next year. 
What will happen to the Colorado Springs plant remains unclear. The 500,000-square-foot operation provides 50 percent of the chips Atmel sells. 
Atmel spokesman Peter Schuman said Sunday that the plant is an important part of the Atmel supply chain and many details still need to be worked out. 
According to the Colorado Springs Gazette (http://tinyurl.com/nvwjtbo ), San Jose, Calif.-based Atmel has been exploring a sale since CEO Steven Laub announced plans in May to retire in August. 
Atmel operates the only remaining semiconductor manufacturing plant in Colorado Springs. Related content
